Package view

Class UIElements

java.lang.Object
view.UIElements
public class UIElements extends Object
This class contains methods that create and return different elements of the user interface for all scenes in all game states such as labels, buttons and combo-boxes for the Tic-Tac-Toe GUI. The class uses the CSSStyles class to apply CSS styles to the elements.

  • Method Details

    • getLabel

      public static javafx.scene.control.Label getLabel(String text, int fontSize)
      Create a text label with the specified text and font size. DEFAULT STYLE: white text fill, Arial font, bold font.
      Parameters:
      text - the text to be displayed on the label.
      fontSize - the desired font size for the label.
      Returns:
      A Label with the specified text and font size.

    • getScoreLabel

      public static javafx.scene.control.Label getScoreLabel(Player player, TicTacToeBoard board)
      Create a text label that displays the score of the specified player in the Tic-Tac-Toe game. DEFAULT STYLE: UIConstants specified player label text size, Arial font, bold font.
      Parameters:
      player - the player whose score is to be displayed.
      board - the board object that holds the player's score information.
      Returns:
      A Label containing the specified player's score information.

    • getNextButton

      public static javafx.scene.control.Button getNextButton()
      Create a next button. (DEFAULT STYLE: UIConstants specified next button length and height, UIConstants specified next button font size, gray background, white text fill, Arial font, bold font.)
      Returns:
      A next button, labeled as 'Next'.

    • getBackButton

      public static javafx.scene.control.Button getBackButton()
      Create a back button. (DEFAULT STYLE: UIConstants specified back button length and height, UIConstants specified back button font size, gray background, white text fill, Arial font, bold font.)
      Returns:
      A back button, labeled as '<'.

    • getSymbolPromptCombobox

      public static javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> getSymbolPromptCombobox(String text)
      Create a combo box that is used to prompt the user to select a symbol for the game. (DEFAULT STYLE: UIConstants specified combo-box length and height, UIConstats specified combo-box font size, Arial font.)
      Parameters:
      text - the text to be displayed as the prompt for the ComboBox.
      Returns:
      A ComboBox with the given text, containing options for the user to select a symbol for the game.

    • getRadioButton

      public static javafx.scene.control.RadioButton getRadioButton(String text, javafx.scene.control.ToggleGroup toggleGroup)
      Create a radio button A radio button is a control that allows the user to make a single selection from a toggle group of other radio buttons. (DEFAULT STYLE: UIConstants specified radio button font size, white text fill, Arial font, bold font.)
      Parameters:
      text - the text displayed on the radio button
      toggleGroup - the group in which the radio button belongs to
      Returns:
      A RadioButton with the given text.

    • getBoardTile

      public static javafx.scene.control.Button getBoardTile()
      Create a button representing a tile on the board. (DEFAULT STYLE: UIConstants specified board tile length and height, UIConstants specified font size, full opacity [when button is disabled during computer's turn, it doesn't become transparent], white text fill, white border color, Arial font, bold font, and black background color.)
      Returns:
      A button representing a tile on the board.

    • getUIBoardLayout

      public static javafx.scene.layout.GridPane getUIBoardLayout(TicTacToeBoard board)
      Create a GridPane as a form of representation for the Tic-Tac-Toe game. (DEFAULT STYLE: black background and center alignment on the screen)
      Parameters:
      board - the Tic-Tac-Toe board that the GridPane will represent
      Returns:
      UI representation of the Tic-Tac-Toe game in the form of a 3x3 GridPane

    • getEndOfGamePrompt

      public static javafx.scene.control.Alert getEndOfGamePrompt(String result)
      Creates an alert to display the end of game result.
      Parameters:
      result - The result of the game, whether it was a win, loss, or draw.
      Returns:
      an alert object that displays the end of game result and prompts the user to play again.
